title.narrative: Protection for IDPs and others affected by armed conflict and violence

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to strengthen the protection of IDPs and communities at risk of displacement or in situation of confinement in the departments of Arauca, Norte de Santander, Nariño and Chocó. UNHCR will use CERF funds to provide legal assistance and information on rights to IDPs and others affected by armed conflict; support safe spaces for children at risk of child recruitment; provide psycho-social support and identification and referral of cases of boys and girls at risk of recruitment; and rehabilitate and equip three emergency shelters while ensuring provision of 300 hygiene kits for women and men. 6,312 beneficiaries will benefit from this project, which will be implemented within nine months.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Protection for IDPs and others affected by armed conflict and violence

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS COLOMBIA UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES MULTIPLE EMERGENCIES 2019

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: 2,019 internally displaced persons and others affected by the armed conflict are better protected through the strengthening of community self-protection mechanisms
# of individuals who are aware of self-protection mechanisms
400 internally displaced persons and others affected by the armed conflict have improved access to legal assistance, life-saving information and justice mechanisms
# of individuals who have improved access to legal assistance, life-saving information on basic rights and justice mechanisms
Protection through rehabilitation/equipment of community infrastructures is provided
# of individuals who are protected through the provision of safe and adequate temporary emergency shelter
Risks of child recruitment by armed groups are mitigated through community-based interventions
# of adults and children who are aware of mechanisms and referral pathways to prevent child recruitment
# of girls and boys at risk who receive psycho-social support as well as support to their family
# of girls and boys who are at high risk of recruitment that are referred to an educational safe space
# of girls and boys whose risks of being recruited is mitigated by community based-interventions
